sub_title: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)
summary:
I design services and systems to enable circularity. 

I have a systems view of life and I enjoy making sense of complex challenges. With 20+ years of experience in design research, UX strategy, service design, training and facilitation, I am a confident leader that enjoys guiding diverse groups of people through complex change journeys, so that we can find better ways forward together.

I currently focus on creating and improving circular services and systems for IKEA.

certifications.name: Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt Certification

projects.title: Making cities more visitor-friendly (user research and customer journey mapping)
projects.description:
My own city (Alkmaar) asked me to help them map a specific target audience and their expectations of Alkmaar, as well as their actual experience. I set up a special user research plan, where we invited people to visit Alkmaar and map their feedback. With this feedback we created a persona as well as a customer journey map and identified gaps and opportunities to improve their experience.

I am also doing this same research and mapping for Älmhult, Sweden, the birthplace of IKEA. For this project, we aim to create an app that supports visitors to this town and make them aware of the hidden gems of the town.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: User researcher/IA for Inter IKEA Systems Transformation of conceptual information
projects.description:
The conceptual information about IKEA (what makes IKEA unique) needed to be transformed to help the IKEA co-workers meet the customer in the IKEA-way. Much of this information was available in paper manuals and on different online platforms, where it is difficult to find and understand.

My role in this global project is to understand what users in different countries and cultures need and how the information should be presented to suit their needs, meaning: relevant, customer-focused, multichannel and responsive (on desktop and mobile). 

I set up and executed several user research iterations, using relevant methods (user interviews, concept tests, surveys, usability testing) to gather and analyse what users need and also to gather feedback on iterative designs and solutions. The insights gathered are used to iteratively improve designs. The final user tests was a global moderated user interview and usability test that I conducted in Norway, Germany, Dubai, Singapore and the UK. Based on this test the project was launched.

I was the user researcher for this project but was also involved in setting up the information architecture, reviewing the interaction and visual design and helping with the content structure and life cycle management of the content.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Facilitating Innovatielab using the business model canvas for Reed Business Information
projects.description: Facilitation of a 2 day workshop for 20 young high potential employees. We used the Business Model and Value Proposition canvasses to come up with new customer-centric products and services. These ideas and prototypes were presented to a jury including the CEO.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: User research for Philips Digital Accelerators (in-company start-ups)
projects.description: At Philips I supported two projects by doing user research (quantitative and qualitative) for 2 Lean Startup projects.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Strategy, structure and sketches for small business websites
projects.description:
When you're self-employed it is quite difficult to decide which information should be on your website. Often, you want to tell too much and you lose sight of your customer and the goals they want to achieve on your website and with you as a business. 

In a few hours I can help you find the core of your business and help your customers to find the answers they need on your website. Together we create a logical structure and sketches that you can take to your website designer so they can build the site.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Expert Reviews to improve online success
projects.description: I like optimising existing sites by looking at it from the user perspective. How can we improve the usability and conversion? I will not only tell you what's not working, but will also give you advice for improvements in both content and design, based on science and years of experience. I will explain why certain things work or don't work, so you can continuously improve your site based on a set of principles.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Noordhoff Publishers customer journey mapping
projects.description: I helped Noordhoff (a large educational publisher) to gather user insights and create 4 customer journey maps for their main target audiences. Based on these journey maps we identified opportunities for improving the customer experience.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Usability testing for a housing cooperation
projects.description: I set up and facilitated a usability test of a decision tree. We wanted to find out how users used the current website and if the decision tree would be faster and better. We measured the time on task and user success rate. Based on this input the company could take a design decision for their website.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: User research Funding Circle
projects.description: Funding Circle is a marketplace for investors and small businesses. For their UK-market they wanted to explore a new, innovative, idea to support their customers (small business owners) in their finances. I set-up, facilitated and analysed 18 sessions to gather deep insights in an interview and get feedback on the design and user flows of their digital concept (both mobile and desktop) in London and Manchester. The result included strategic advice as well as content and design improvements and opportunities.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: UX research for Inter IKEA Systems' global intranet
projects.description: I supported the product owner of the global IKEA intranet (200.000 users) in prioritizing the product backlog and writing user stories. My focus was on making the intranet more user-centric by doing user research, analysing web and search analytics and benchmarking the user experience by performing tests (time on task, completion rate, ease of use/customer effort scores). Based on these insights I proposed improvements and work on optimizing (amongst others) the navigation and search experience.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Documentation experience improvement for IKEA in Sweden
projects.description: For IKEA I helped map how available information for co-workers in the store could be made available in a better format, so that they could quickly work with it. To do this I performed many user interviews and organised workshops to design better documents, structures and flows. I also created personas and customer journeys together with the department to create a more user-centered mindset.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Air France KLM Research Top Task research for homepage
projects.description:
For AIR FRANCE KLM I executed a complete Top Task research project. The outcome is used for the new design of the AIR FRANCE KLM homepages/websites. 

For this project I collected 300 tasks from former research, webanalytics, social media analysis, customer journey maps and interviews with stakeholders and customers. I created a long list and worked towards a list of 100 tasks. Customers chose the 5 top tasks for their specific journey step. I presented my progress monthly in team meetings in Paris and Amsterdam and the outcome of the project is used in design teams to secure that information is prioritized to suit the customer needs.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: User research and Customer Journey Mapping workshops for DELA
projects.description: I set up and facilitated user research for several target audiences and helped to create personas and customer journey maps together with a multidisciplinary team. We identified gaps and opportunities for improvement in both the content strategy and website design and identified new services to improve the customer experience.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Creation of user experience research tools for Inter IKEA Systems
projects.description:
Inter IKEA Systems wants their co-workers to understand their users better. They wanted to provide them with tools to gather insights about the co-workers.

I did research to understand the stakeholder goals and user needs. Based on this research I created 10 user research tools. I described how to work with them and when to use them and included templates to standardize the ways of working. The UX research toolkit was published  on the global IKEA intranet.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Optimisation of customer journey and UX of Sanoma webshops
projects.description: Sanoma is a magazine and online publisher that works with subscriptions. The user flow of ordering subscriptions for yourself or someone else was unclear. I helped to map the user flows and made it more customer-focused, more seamless, more user-friendly and more conversion oriented. I created a new design and added more conversion opportunities.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: User Experience optimisation for Pluimen.nl
projects.description:
Pluimen is a successful supplier of end-of-year gifts. They wanted to make the orientation and ordering process more user friendly and more optimised for conversion. They also wanted to identify new moments in the customer journey to sell their products.  

I set up user research that aimed to map the entire process of selecting and ordering and eventually distributing the end-of-year gifts. I conducted some of the research myself, but also instructed Pluimen-employees to conduct their own research by doing user interviews. 

We shared the insights and identified usability issues and opportunities for new services and products. Based on these insights and opportunities we designed mockups that we tested with users.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Innovation research for online tools for nurses
projects.description: The publisher of the magazine "Nursing" wanted to identify opportunities to support nurses in their work process. I set up and facilitated user interviews to gather insights. Based on these insights I facilitated a brainstorm for potential new products and services for nurses. 8 New ideas were born and were turned into business cases.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

projects.title: Research workflow of water mechanics at PWN and create improvements
projects.description:
By mapping the process of the water mechanics I aimed to create a more efficient and user and customer centric way of working. I gathered insights, designed a new tool, and facilitated many brainstorm and design workshops. 

As a result, I designed one system to replace 8 different systems to facilitate the full workflow. This way, the communication with the office as well as with the customers was improved.

contributors.headline: Service Design Leader for Circularity at IKEA (Global/Digital)

profile_positions.description: I listen and make sense of human, planet and business problems so that we can collaborate to create better or new solutions to complex problems. I currently focus on creating and improving circular (digital) journeys for IKEA's products, coworkers and customers.
profile_positions.title: Service Design Leader for Circularity

profile_positions.description: I focus on improving the experience of websites, webshops, intranets, software and mobile apps. Based on user research I analyse what works and what could be improved, using a range of methods and involving stakeholders, co-workers and users.
profile_positions.title: UX & CX Research Specialist - Service Designer (independent)

profile_positions.description: Canadian digital design agency Jam3 is starting up an EMEA office in Amsterdam. As their first Amsterdam-based senior strategist I provide research insights to nurture the creative direction on pitches and projects in order to create user-centered digital experiences for (mostly) large global companies.
profile_positions.title: Senior Design Strategist (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
I created content for 4 remote sessions and facilitated the sessions for 16 participants using Teams and Miro. In the four sessions I shared theory and guided participants through immersive sessions around: 

- UX fundamentals and UX roles
- UX research methods and problem definition
- Research data analysis and customer definition
- Idea generation and UX concepting
profile_positions.title: UX Bootcamp (remote) facilitator (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
Älmhult (Sweden) is the birthplace of IKEA. Thousands of IKEA employees visit this small town for trainings, meetings and events. For this project, we aimed to create a digital solution that supports visitors to Älmhult to make them aware of the hidden gems of the town and cool activities that are organised for the visitors. 

What we did
We created visitor profiles profiles to align stakeholders on the different visitor groups and their customer journeys. We defined pain points and opportunities for improvement, so that the visitor experience could be more seamless and inspiring. The outcomes of these sessions will be input for a an app or website that will support visitors before, during and after their visit to Älmhult.

- Workshop facilitation
- Customer journey mapping
- Personas and user needs
- Co-creation with stakeholders
- Concept sketching
profile_positions.title: Visitor Journey Facilitator (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
The conceptual information about IKEA (what makes IKEA unique) needed to be transformed to help the IKEA co-workers meet the customer in the IKEA-way. Much of this information was available in paper manuals and on different online platforms, where it was difficult to find and understand.

My role in this global project was to understand what users in different countries and cultures need and how the information should be presented to suit their needs, meaning: relevant, customer-focused, multichannel and responsive (on desktop and mobile).

I set up and executed several user research iterations, using relevant methods (user interviews, concept tests, surveys, usability testing) to gather and analyse what users need and also to gather feedback on iterative designs and solutions. The insights gathered are used to iteratively improve designs. The final user tests was a global moderated user interview and usability test that I conducted in Norway, Germany, Dubai, Singapore and the UK. Based on this test the project was launched.

What the client said: 
"Miranda is self-going with little need for steer, but she has a great ability to work together where needed. She is great in organising big meetings or events. She is especially good at untangling complex situations and driving changes in ways of working."

- UX Strategy
- User research
- Usability testing
- Design reviews
- Information architecture
- Content strategy
- Lifecycle management process 
- Workshop facilitation
- Projectmanagement
profile_positions.title: UX Strategist and Research Lead (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
I supported the product owner of the global IKEA intranet (200.000 users) in prioritizing the product backlog and writing user stories. My focus was on making the intranet more user-centric by doing user research, analysing web and search analytics and benchmarking the user experience by performing tests (time on task, completion rate, ease of use/customer effort scores). Based on these insights I proposed improvements and work on optimizing (amongst others) the navigation and search experience.

What the client said:
" Building bridges. This is something Miranda is great at and has consistently done. She has built bridges between teams, users and us all as an organization.  We have taken her ideas and woven them into our way of working, meaning Miranda’s work will have a lasting impact."

- Agile 
- User stories
- Quantitative user research
- Stakeholder management
- Usability testing
- Search optimisation
profile_positions.title: Employee Experience Specialist (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
I researched and mapped how information for co-workers in the store could be made available in a better format, so that they could quickly work with it. To do this I performed many user interviews with IKEA employees around the world and organised workshops to design better documents, structures and flows. I also created personas and customer journeys together with the department to create a more user-centered mindset.

- User interviews
- Agile
- Customer journey mapping
- Stakeholder management
- Concept sketching
- Workshop facilitation
- User centered mindset
profile_positions.title: UX Strategist (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
Noordhoff (the largest educational publisher of the Netherlands) wanted to improve their digital connection with teachers, so teachers would benefit more from online resources for their classes. 

Together with a multidisciplinary team of publishers, content and marketing professionals and customer service representatives, we mapped the customer journey for the 4 main market segments. I trained the employees to do user interviews and usability tests and let them meet teachers so they could gather insights about the current digital experience to identify pain points. 

Based on the interview insights, the teams created 4 customer journey maps for their main target audiences. Based on these journey maps we identified opportunities for improving the customer experience.

- User interview training
- User centered mindset
- Customer journey mapping
- Co-creation facilitation
- Innovation
profile_positions.title: Customer Experience Facilitator (freelance)

profile_positions.description:
Funding Circle is a marketplace for investors and small businesses. For their UK-market they wanted to explore a new, innovative, idea to support their customers (small business owners) in their finances. 

I set-up, facilitated and analysed 18 sessions to gather deep insights in an interview. I explored feelings and facts around data security and trust. Besides, I gathered feedback on the design and user flows of their digital concept (both mobile and desktop). The result included strategic advice as well as content and design improvements and opportunities.

- Deep user interviews
- Usability testing
- Strategic analysis of outcomes
- Improvement of content and design

I set up and facilitated a user test that measured the time on task and user success rate. Based on this input the company could take a design decision for their website. 

- Usability testing
- UX Improvement
